availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Edmonson County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Polly Williams Keeton in Wayne County, Kentucky, on December 10, 1844. Father of Anna Keeton, Nimord Keeton, Keelen Keeton, Rebecca Keeton, Martha Keeton, and Sarah F. Keeton. Farmer in Wayne County in 1850. Farmer in Brownsville, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 30th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as a private beginning on February 3, 1864. Reported as deserted from Monticello, Kentucky, on March 25, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Wayne County, Division 1, p. 330A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Edmonson County, Brownsville, p. 109.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Wayne County Marriages, Film #000591550, p. 462.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0399.
